title: Rabadon's Deathcap is Broken
body:
I just played a game on Poro King with MF, had 285 AP and brought the Deathcap as my 4th item, I only gained the passive 100 AP in this instance, I did not gain the +120 I should have had on top of it all. So intead of finishing with ~650 AP, I should have finished the game closer to 800 AP.

I thought I was reading it wrong, so I sold it, went back to 285 AP, re-brought it and still only went up to 385 AP.

So I tried another game as Kog on Bots, someone who can kill easy to get fast gold and benefit from AP. I got up to 233 AP, with Deathcap it went to 395, so working as intended there with the +162 AP from the item.

I am not sure if it is AP MF, Poro King or certain items in a certain order that have done it, but dammit, I want my +120 AP!

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

replies.body:
35% of 285 = 99.75

{{item:1052}} + {{item:1058}} + {{item:1026}} = 120

120 + 99.75 = 219.75, you already had the 3 components, so all you got was the passive amount, thus the 100 ap. Not hard to figure.

when you buy a component of deathcap it gives you the 20, 40 or 60 AP at the time of the purchase. when you complete the deathcap, since you already have 1 (or more) of the component/s, you only get the additional AP that doesnt include the item/s you already bought. so if you had an amp tome that gave you 20 AP, if you finish deathcap you only get 100 AP and then the passive, because you already had an original 20 AP in your inventory

He sold deathcap, was at 285 ap, then bought it, and went up less than 120 ap from no-deathcap. If he sold it as he said, that's a problem.
